name.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

questiontext.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

subquestion.text: What is the frame rate for NTSC video?
What should you do with your videotapes before recording on them?
What technique can you use while shooting to optimize video compression later on?

answer.text: Keep camera still and let the subject provide movement

subquestion.text: When creating graphics for conversion to video, do not place critical information such as text in the outside 15% of the image. Instead, keep it within the _______ (two words) area.
Which broadcast video standard is used in North America?

name.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

questiontext.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

subquestion.text: Which color combinations work best for on screen text?

answer.text: Light text on a dark background for TV

subquestion.text: Which compression scheme is best suited for CD-ROM playback?
The digital video and audio compression schemes that compress a video for delivery and then decode it during playback are called?
The codec that is within both AVI and Quicktime and is optimized for CD-ROM playback is _________.
Computer monitors draw the lines of an entire frame in a single pass; this technique is called?

name.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

questiontext.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

subquestion.text: Generation loss occurs when:

answer.text: An analog tape is copied to another analog tape

subquestion.text: A hard disk system that will support high-speed data transfer rates is called a _____.
How many horizontal lines of resolution does this North American Standard have?
In a video camera, the sensor that picks up the light is called a CCD. CCD stands for?
In a video camera, which component converts light into an electronic signal?

name.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

questiontext.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

subquestion.text: The length of time it takes the CD-ROM player to locate specific data on the CD-ROM disc is called?
Most television cut off portions at the edges of a broadcast video signal. What is this phenomenon called?
MPEG stands for:
Quicktime movies being prepared for a CD or Web site should be processed so that the audio and video segments are interleaved together and all of the info is in one data file. This is called?
Red or green should be avoided as cue colors because:

answer.text: Color blind individual cant see them correctly

name.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

questiontext.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

subquestion.text: Removing a residual magnetic field that distorts the colors on a TV screen is called?
A single frame of video is made up of two fields _______ fields.
The technique in which playback of a video starts as soon as enough data has transferred to the user's computer to sustain this playback is called?
Television screens use a process of building a single frame from two fields to help prevent flicker on TV screens is a technique called _______.
The television signal format used in France, Russia and a few other countries is known as _____.

name.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

questiontext.text: Match the following questions to its correct answer.

subquestion.text: Video is compressed and decompressed using a ______.
A video signal transmitted with all the signals mixed together and carried on single cabled is called?
Why is compression necessary when working with digital video?

answer.text: Because the file sizes and data rates of uncompressed video exceed the capabilities of common computer hardware.

name.text: Matching Type. Select the appropriate terms to complete the sentences.

questiontext.text: Matching Type. Select the appropriate terms to complete the sentences.

subquestion.text: An object seen by the human eye remains chemically mapped on the retina for a brief time after viewing. This phenomenon is called _______________.
The human mind needs to conceptually complete a perceived action. This phenomenon is called _______________.
To make an object travel across the screen while it changes its shape, just change the shape and also move or _______________ it a few pixels for each frame.
The animation technique made famous by Disney involves showing a different image for each framThis technique is called _______________ animation.
The first and last frames of an action are called _______________.
The series of frames in between the first and last frames in an action are drawn in a process called _______________.

In computer animation terminology, _______________ usually refers to special methods that allow images to blend or otherwise mix their colors to produce special transparencies, inversions, and effects.
The study of the movement and motion of structures that have joints is called _______________.
The effect in which one image transforms into another is known as _______________.

name.text: A computers output on the monitor is calibrated to display an image:

questiontext.text: A computers output on the monitor is calibrated to display an image:

answer.text: Smaller than the actual monitors capability
Larger than the actual monitors capability
Exactly the same size as the actual monitors capability
That adjusts automatically to the monitors capability
Of a fixed size, whether it is larger or smaller than the monitors capability depends on the monitor.

name.text: The process in which you link objects such as hands to arms and define their ...

questiontext.text: The process in which you link objects such as hands to arms and define their relationships and limits (for example, elbows cannot bend backward), then drag these parts around and let the computer calculate the result is called:

name.text: The standard frame rate of computer animations is:

questiontext.text: The standard frame rate of computer animations is:

answer.text: There is no standard; it depends on the file's settings.

name.text: The technical limitation you are likely to encounter in creating animations is:

questiontext.text: The technical limitation you are likely to encounter in creating animations is:

answer.text: the ability to accurately calculate physical actions

name.text: The term cel derives from:

questiontext.text: The term cel derives from:

answer.text: the concept of each action in a sequence being a separate element or "cell"
the fact that the inks used in early animations were based on extracts from celery plants
an abbreviation of the phrase "composite element"
the fact that the first animations were the work of communist dissidents who were organized into cells
the clear celluloid sheets that were used for drawing each frame

name.text: The video technique that allows you to choose a color or range of colors that...

questiontext.text: The video technique that allows you to choose a color or range of colors that become transparent, allowing the video image to be visible behind those colors in the overlying image, is known by all of the following except:

questiontext.text: To create a smooth transition between two images when morphing, it's important to set numerous:

name.text: To keep the post-compression file size at absolute minimums, Flash makes ...

questiontext.text: To keep the post-compression file size at absolute minimums, Flash makes extensive use of:

name.text: Today's computer animation programs most closely resemble:

questiontext.text: Today's computer animation programs most closely resemble:

answer.text: the "phi" phenomenon described by Carl Jung

name.text: Today, the most widely used tool for creating vector-based animations is:

questiontext.text: Today, the most widely used tool for creating vector-based animations is:

name.text: True or False: Component video provides superior quality to composite video ...

questiontext.text: True or False: Component video provides superior quality to composite video because the video signal is broken into three distinct channels.

name.text: True or False: Televisions and computer monitors do not use the same color ...

questiontext.text: True or False: Televisions and computer monitors do not use the same color gamut.

name.text: True or False: To prevent flickering, on screen text should use lines that ...

questiontext.text: True or False: To prevent flickering, on screen text should use lines that are one pixel wide False; be thicker than one pixel.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT a codec?

name.text: Which of the following is NOT a good a idea when creating titles (text) to be...

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT a good a idea when creating titles (text) to be used in video?

answer.text: Font for titles should be plain, sans serif, and bold enough to be easily read
When you are laying text onto a dark background, use white or a light color for the text
Do not kern you letters too tightly
If you use underlining or drawn graphics, make sure your lines are only one pixel wide.
Use a drop shadow to help separate the text from the background

name.text: Which of the following is NOT a recommendation for caring for videotapes?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT a recommendation for caring for videotapes?

answer.text: Always fast-fwd new tapes to the end and then rewind them to make sure that tape tension is even from beginning to end
Run your tape through the recorder once with the lens cap on and without audio input
Do not reuse 8mm video cassettes, as their small size makes them susceptible to stretch.
Always make a backup copy of these tapes before you begin editing
Never remove the break off tab on the back of your original video cassettes; doing so renders the tap unusable with some decks

name.text: Which of the following is NOT a TV signal format?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT a TV signal format?

name.text: Which of the following is NOT recommended for optimal video playback from ...

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT recommended for optimal video playback from CD-ROM?

answer.text: Use a large video window and a high frame rate.
Interleave the audio and video segments together

name.text: Which of these is not a reason why animation is perceived as motion?

questiontext.text: Which of these is not a reason why animation is perceived as motion?

answer.text: An image remains in the eye chemically for a brief time after viewing.
Our mind tries to "connect the dots" by completing perceived actions.
The use of darker colors for moving objects is interpreted by the mind as motion.
A sequence of images is read as continuous motion.
All of the above are valid reasons.
